decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers: 772.03(R1); 772.04(R1); Plan 772.05(R2); 772.06 and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).

The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those stated on approved plans, numbers: 772.03(R1); 772.04(R1); Plan 772.05(R2) and shall thereafter be retained as such.

To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to ensure that the proposed development does not have an adverse effect upon the appearance of the existing building in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no additional windows, doors or other openings shall be constructed in the walls or roof slopes of the development hereby approved, other than those detailed in the approved drawings.
To prevent inappropriate overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).
No groundworks shall occur in regard to the approved development unless a variation is agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

To inform and update the assessment of the threat to the archaeological deposits and to ensure any heritage assets found in the archaeological interest area are protected in accordance with Policy 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of The London Plan (2021), Policy HE1 of Hillingdon Council's Local Plan Part 1 Strategic Policies (2012), and DMHB 7 of Hillingdon Council's Local Plan Part 2 Development Management Policies (2020).
description: Erection of a first-floor rear and side extension; demolition of front porch and replacement with a supported canopy
